circumstances.description: Mississippi Sound just off the coast line
circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: The lower torso of a white male was found floating in the Mississippi Sound just off shore from Pascagoula, MS. The remains were wearing dark work pants. In the pocket was a key-fob from Pensacola Florida car lot. On the back of the fob was what appeared to be scratched "Court Van" The remains were classified as obese and were calcified. According to a forensic anthropologist, the remains could have been in the water for as long as 5 years.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Known as Hope, she was found with two other unidentified females, known as Charity and Faith, in an apartment complex after Hurricane Camille, a Category 5 storm hit the Mississippi Gulf Coast, killing 256. Some sources state that one of the women's body was found near, or in, City Hall. It is possible that all three knew each other and were friends. All three are buried in Evergreen Cemetery in Gulfport.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: On September 3, 2007, a boater found a male body floating in the Gulf of Mexico about 6 miles south of the Mississippi Coast Coliseum in Harrison County, MS.  Autopsy revealed the remains were a white male, 50-70 years of age, approximately 6 feet tall, 185 pounds, with balding gray hair and a beard, missing three front teeth.

physicalDescription.headHairDescription: Bald on top but had approximately 4" long gray hair around the back/sides of head

physicalDescription.facialHairDescription: Gray and white whiskers on the face about 1/2" in length.  Whiskers extend onto the neck where they are black and gray 1/2"- 3/4" in length.

Scar- branching scar of the central chin
Scar- curved scar on his left elbow- about 3-4" in length
Scar- 3 scars on right knee from orthoscopic surgery
Scar- right index fingertip (finger possibly shorter due to damage)
Scar- long ovoid scar about 4 1/2" in length centered 4" below elbow

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery:
On November 10, 1980 hunters found the skeletal remains of a white female in the woods near a small creek.  Anthropologist later determined that she was a white female, 5'2"-5'5", and had been in the woods approximately 3-18 months prior to discovery.  Cause and manner of death are unknown but homicide is strongly suspected.  Facial reconstruction available.

FGG results indicate primarily Greek ethnicity.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: A cranium was found in the woods behind 583 E. Pratcher Road by a lady hunting her horse. The cranium was found in a wooded area under some trees. An additional search was conducted by Dr. Nicholas Herrmann and students of Mississippi State University under the supervision of the Panola County Coroner and the Panola County's Sheriff Department. They found two femora(left & right) near the original location of the cranium along with a piece of clothing, a gold necklace and a car jack.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: A cranium of a small child was discovered at the Sharkey Issaquena County line. The cranium was found by Ricky Hayes, an employee of Duett Hack Hole Services. Deputy Carolyn Tillis was dispatched to the scene along with the Sharkey County Coroner Angelia Eason to retrieve the skull. The cranium was sent to the Mississippi State Medical Examiners Office and was then sent to Dr. Nicholas Herrmann of Mississippi State University for anthropological analysis. A follow-up survey will be conducted to search for additional remains; no date set.
